test_reachable()[source]¶
aiida.backends.tests.cmdline.commands.test_computer.generate_setup_options(ordereddict)[source]¶

Given an (ordered) dict, returns a list of options

Note that at this moment the implementation only supports long options (i.e. –option=value) and not short ones (-o value). Set a value to None to avoid the ‘=value’ part.

Parameters:ordereddict – as generated by generate_setup_options_dict()
Returns:a list to be passed as command-line arguments.
aiida.backends.tests.cmdline.commands.test_computer.generate_setup_options_dict(replace_args={}, non_interactive=True)[source]¶

Return a OrderedDict with the key-value pairs for the command line.

I use an ordered dict because for changing entries it’s easier to have keys (so, a dict) but the commands might require a specific order, so I use an OrderedDict.

This should be then passed to generate_setup_options().

Parameters:replace_args – a dictionary with the keys to replace, if needed
Returns:an OrderedDict with the command-line options
aiida.backends.tests.cmdline.commands.test_computer.generate_setup_options_interactive(ordereddict)[source]¶

Given an (ordered) dict, returns a list of options

Note that at this moment the implementation only supports long options (i.e. –option=value) and not short ones (-o value). Set a value to None to avoid the ‘=value’ part.

Parameters:ordereddict – as generated by generate_setup_options_dict()
Returns:a list to be passed as command-line arguments.

Test that using a file that already exists, which is the case when using NamedTemporaryFile, will raise.

Test that passing the -f/–force option will overwrite the output file even if it exists.

Test that the captured output is an empty string when the -s/–silent option is passed.

test_migrate_tar_gz()[source]¶

Test that -F/–archive-format option can be used to write a tar.gz instead.

test_migrate_versions_old()[source]¶

Migrating archives with a version older than the current should work.

test_migrate_versions_recent()[source]¶

Migrating an archive with the current version should exit with non-zero status.

aiida.backends.tests.cmdline.commands.test_export.delete_temporary_file(filepath)[source]¶

Attempt to delete a file, given an absolute path. If the deletion fails because the file does not exist the exception will be caught and passed. Any other exceptions will raise.

Parameters:filepath – the absolute file path
aiida.backends.tests.cmdline.commands.test_export.get_archive_file(archive)[source]¶

Return the absolute path of the archive file used for testing purposes. The expected path for these files:

aiida.backends.tests.export_import_test_files.migrate
Parameters:archive – the relative filename of the archive
Returns:absolute filepath of the archive test file

test_import_old_url_archives()[source]¶

Test import of old URL archives Expected behavior: Automatically migrate to newest version and import correctly. TODO: Update ‘url’ to point at correct commit and file. Now it is pointing to yakutovicha’s commit, but when PR #2478 has been merged in aiidateam:develop, url should be updated to point to the, essentially same, commit, but in aiidateam. Furthermore, the filename should be changed from ‘_no_UPF.aiida’ to ‘_simple.aiida’.

mock_profiles(**kwargs)[source]¶

Create mock profiles and a runner object to invoke the CLI commands.

Note: this cannot be done in the setUp or setUpClass methods, because the temporary configuration instance is not generated until the test function is entered, which calls the with_temporary_config_instance decorator.

test_run_workfunction()[source]¶

Regression test for #2165

If the script that is passed to verdi run is not compiled correctly, running workfunctions from the script that are defined within the script will fail, as the inspect module will not correctly be able to determin the full path of the source file.
